item.title: Coinbase, Bitpay and Bitcoin Core
item.description:
Coinbase, Bitpay and Bitcoin Core

A website shows their services can be purchased via Coinbase and Bitpay. I searched for information and found Bitcoin Core from bitcoin.org/en/choose-your-wallet and I think it is very popular among

item.title: IBM Brings Blockchains to the Cloud - Bitcoin News
item.description:
IBM Brings Blockchains to the Cloud - Bitcoin News

Recently, IBM Also read: Bitcoin's Next Adoption Phase Imminent as Public Interest Surges announced a new blockchain architecture based in the cloud after working with "hundreds of clients, startups, and developers." The protocol is a cloud service that address security standards, regulatory compliance with Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS 140-2) and Evaluation Assurance Levels (EAL).

item.title: How Should We Abbreviate Bitcoin and Ether?
item.description:
How Should We Abbreviate Bitcoin and Ether?

Whilst the term 'BTC' has long been the standard abbreviation for Bitcoin, there is a growing call from the Bitcoin community and exchanges in particular to begin referring to it as 'XBT'. However, its semi-pseudonymous creator, Satoshi Nakamoto, still refers to it as ' BTC '. What is a proper way to abbreviate Bitcoin?

item.title: Wladimir van der Laan: "There is Something Truly Fishy Going On"
item.description:
Wladimir van der Laan: "There is Something Truly Fishy Going On"

Moreover, there is a grave concern regarding the amount of scammers and opportunists Bitcoin has attracted in the past few years. Wladimir van der Laan, one of the Bitcoin Core developers, has shared his thoughts with the world on recent Satoshi Nakamoto debacle.

item.title: Spondoolies-Tech Shuts Down Operations Effectively Immediately
item.description:
Spondoolies-Tech Shuts Down Operations Effectively Immediately

Spondoolies-Tech was one of the most-renowned Bitcoin hardware manufacturers to make a name for itself in recent years, but as it turns out, the company had ceased operations a few days ago. This announcement caught everyone by surprise, as things were looking quite positive for the company so far.

item.title: New sgminer Fork With HMQ1725 Algorithm Support for AMD GPUs
item.description:
New sgminer Fork With HMQ1725 Algorithm Support for AMD GPUs

There is now an sgminer fork for GPU mining Espers (ESP) that uses HMQ1725 algorithm available ( source) that works on AMD GPUs. The miner is still in an early beta and you may experience issues trying to use it, it is recommended to be with 15.12 drivers as older or newer versions might not work, the latest Crimson release does not for sure.

item.title: Updated Windows Binary of the ccMiner 1.5.80-git Fork by SP for Maxwell
item.description:
Updated Windows Binary of the ccMiner 1.5.80-git Fork by SP for Maxwell

A quick update of the public ccMiner fork by SP of his Nvidia Maxwell optimized miner in the form of a Windows binary compiled from the latest Git source code of the ccMiner 1.5.80-git SP-MOD fork ( source).

item.title: The Current State of X11 ASIC Miners and the X11 Market
item.description:
The Current State of X11 ASIC Miners and the X11 Market

If you are in the market for X11 ASICs then you might want to reconsider as the profitability at the moment is nothing like when the first batch of iBeLink X11 miners started shipping.

item.title: Nvidia Introducing The GeForce GTX 1080 and GTX 1070
item.description:
Nvidia Introducing The GeForce GTX 1080 and GTX 1070

Nvidia has announced the first GPUs from their next generation of consumer 16nm FinFET GPUs using the Pascal architecture including some specifications and new features along with the prices and release dates.

item.title: Bitcoin Mining Equipment Producer Spondoolies Dissolved by Court | Finance Magnates
item.description:
Bitcoin Mining Equipment Producer Spondoolies Dissolved by Court | Finance Magnates

A sad ending for Israeli Bitcoin mining equipment producer Spondoolies-Tech. The firm has been dissolved by a court in southern Israel after it failed to pay its employees since April. Founded in 2013 by a group of Israeli high-tech veterans and cryptocurrency champions, Spondoolies has raised about $12 million to design high efficiency dedicated Bitcoin mining rigs.
